title: Language, Culture, and Society of Spain
yc_attrs:
This course can be applied towards the following Yale College distributional requirements:
  • Humanities and Arts
  • Language (5)
description: 5-week program: based in Valencia, Spain. A language program that explores historical and contemporary issues in Spanish culture. Set in Valencia, a city founded by the Romans 2,000 years ago, this course aims to reflect on both Spanish ancient heritage and modernity. Key works of literature will foster discussion on a wide range of topics such as the environment, the Mediterranean trade, politics and religion. Students will integrate each weekâ€™s thematic content into real life observations to reflect on the fabric of Spanish society. Prerequisite: SPAN 140 (Intermediate Spanish II) or equivalent proficiency. Enrollment limited. Application deadline: February 15. Students are responsible for arranging travel to and from Valencia and all other program expenses beyond tuition. For further details, such as program costs, prerequisites, exact dates, credits, etc., visit the http://studyabroad.yale.edu/programs/language-culture-society-spain program page on the Yale Study Abroad website.
